actor_awards.notes: A founding member of the Screen Actors Guild (SAG), he served as its president in the late 1950s.[[1](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQF8xvG_LWR4-OKqpWUeZ10FJ5uYdaX2nJ6JmYlAaC8-_XSnl3JqWW5LtSTrUa3BwQg-R6VrF2L_NKxgFoEM5Vn0nl3iCeueLOm2MW_lpHOHkzO3JPQCnVHbf5KQ8WPo6SDhUQFkIGo%3D)][[2](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQELxU0XxQFVaDCB9hpAQmkYa34PDtoe2ohfurc9Jqu4fL7UPR6QkYdhq0_PJtEamiS77anwOlWcMzJmAhn6jgoe8cJ-KIZSbJ_vco0r7WmNhmLsVcddKR9Btug1jhGxIFbjWoI%3D)][[3](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQHYCU9sRrn8oz_AV1BzPW-J3Ic-cfGPwgz6tOXuW-z5fKr-eKVD0KL3Yz-2ej1Z_sutB8_dYklyOJ4Pgyn7Nj9VkqhJR1IXDMgyGd010mCTw-YNFz1dpn-gnaD1z_b8Nsn35Q%3D%3D)] He received the SAG Life Achievement Award in 1980.[[3](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQHYCU9sRrn8oz_AV1BzPW-J3Ic-cfGPwgz6tOXuW-z5fKr-eKVD0KL3Yz-2ej1Z_sutB8_dYklyOJ4Pgyn7Nj9VkqhJR1IXDMgyGd010mCTw-YNFz1dpn-gnaD1z_b8Nsn35Q%3D%3D)][[4](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQGdequVHCnnGk_tJExHX88VTz-91Qr3Mcjn4WSMuEE_QjjrA1YBq6CyjfD5_uA_e_PxBqmKQI0XzhVIHoiicR5w8iRdZ_pRmw4AT3VlVaUV5T_FGYQNKscw7-aww-b0gCKMeT_vuPYuippEOkw1F9_44OcaGZZcBb7oPBY%3D)][[5](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQHo2MTXNt3F-v3K5x7AmH_1rkEk0TXTtSvq7xD2qen0db5C2SaZuaS93I1VknEtZYmz3KqZnSXMtkKf0sFNGwtJ3UvNv4IUkeKZZiEbcLUsingRzn90P91o0eAHP172NKq-oRkqEJWo2G-dJPZ7Qtga-Q%3D%3D)] Best known for playing the father in 'Meet Me in St. Louis' and 'Little Women'.

filmography.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
filmography.role_description: The stern but loving patriarch of the Smith family who upsets the household by announcing a move to New York.
filmography.plot: In the year leading up to the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, the four Smith daughters learn lessons of life and love.

filmography.title: The Postman Always Rings Twice
filmography.role_description: The shrewd District Attorney who suspects foul play and hounds the lovers responsible for a murder.
filmography.plot: A drifter falls for the beautiful wife of a diner owner and they plot to kill her husband.

filmography.title: Little Women
filmography.role_description: The father of the March sisters who is away serving in the Civil War for much of the story.
filmography.plot: The four March sisters grow up in New England during the Civil War while their father is away.

filmography.title: On Moonlight Bay
filmography.role_description: A banker and father who disapproves of his tomboy daughter's romance with a college student.
filmography.plot: A tomboy girl falls in love with the boy next door in Indiana during World War I.

filmography.title: By the Light of the Silvery Moon
filmography.role_description: Ames reprises his role as the grumpy but lovable father in this sequel to 'On Moonlight Bay'.
filmography.plot: A young soldier returns from World War I to his sweetheart, but their marriage plans are stalled by family issues.

filmography.title: The Absent-Minded Professor
filmography.role_description: The college president who is frustrated by the eccentricities of his brilliant professor.
filmography.plot: A college professor invents an anti-gravity substance which a corrupt businessman wants for himself.

filmography.title: Son of Flubber
filmography.role_description: The college president returns to deal with the chaos caused by the professor's new invention.
filmography.plot: The absent-minded professor invents 'flubber gas' which helps the college football team win the big game.

filmography.title: Peyton Place
filmography.role_description: The wealthy mill owner and father of Rodney Harrington in this melodramatic exposé of small-town secrets.
filmography.plot: The secrets, scandals, and tragedies of a small New England town are exposed.

filmography.title: Murders in the Rue Morgue
filmography.role_description: A medical student who investigates a series of murders committed by a mad scientist.
filmography.plot: A mad scientist seeks to mingle human blood with that of an ape to prove his theories of evolution.

filmography.title: Lady in the Lake
filmography.role_description: A publishing executive who hires Philip Marlowe to find his missing wife.
filmography.plot: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired to find a missing woman, leading to a complex web of murder and deception.

filmography.title: They Were Expendable
filmography.role_description: An Army officer who interacts with the PT boat commanders during the defense of the Philippines.
filmography.plot: A PT boat squadron defends the Philippines against the Japanese invasion during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Sound, Best Special Effects

filmography.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
filmography.role_description: A naval intelligence officer who briefs the Doolittle Raiders.
filmography.plot: The story of the first American retaliatory air raid against Japan during World War II, led by Lt. Col. James Doolittle.

filmography.title: Yolanda and the Thief
filmography.role_description: The guardian angel of a naive heiress who protects her from a con artist.
filmography.plot: A con man poses as the guardian angel of a wealthy girl to steal her fortune, but a real angel intervenes.

filmography.title: Battleground
filmography.role_description: A military chaplain who delivers a moving Christmas sermon to the besieged troops at Bastogne.
filmography.plot: A squad of the 101st Airborne Division copes with the Siege of Bastogne during the Battle of the Bulge.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Screenplay, Best Cinematography

filmography.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
filmography.role_description: The kindly grandfather of the main character in Ames' final film role.
filmography.plot: A woman faints at her high school reunion and wakes up in 1960, giving her the chance to relive her youth.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress, Best Cinematography

filmography.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
filmography.role_description: The Secretary of the Navy during the events leading up to the attack on Pearl Harbor.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and the series of American blunders that allowed it to happen.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: The Velvet Touch
filmography.role_description: A Broadway producer who is accidentally killed by his leading lady.
filmography.plot: A famous stage actress accidentally kills her producer and tries to cover up the crime.

filmography.title: Angel Face
filmography.role_description: The father of a mentally unstable young woman who becomes the victim of her murderous plot.
filmography.plot: An ambulance driver is pursued by a beautiful but dangerous young woman with a plan to murder her stepmother.

filmography.title: From the Terrace
filmography.role_description: The cold and distant father of the protagonist, a man consumed by his business.
filmography.plot: An ambitious young executive's marriage crumbles as he climbs the corporate ladder.

filmography.title: The Thin Man Goes Home
filmography.role_description: A character involved in the mystery when Nick and Nora Charles visit Nick's parents.
filmography.plot: Nick and Nora Charles visit Nick's parents in a small town and get involved in a murder investigation.

filmography.title: Song of the Thin Man
filmography.role_description: A bandleader suspect in the final installment of the Thin Man series.
filmography.plot: Nick and Nora Charles investigate the murder of a bandleader aboard a gambling ship.

filmography.title: Anchors Aweigh
filmography.role_description: The naval commander who interacts with the two sailors on leave in Hollywood.
filmography.plot: Two sailors on leave in Hollywood help an aspiring singer get an audition at MGM.

filmography.title: A Date with Judy
filmography.role_description: The father of the title character in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A teenager thinks her father is having an affair when he is actually taking rhumba lessons.

filmography.title: Week-End at the Waldorf
filmography.role_description: A newspaper editor who gets mixed up in the intersecting stories at the Waldorf hotel.
filmography.plot: Several stories intertwine during a weekend at the famous Waldorf-Astoria hotel in New York City.

filmography.title: Testament
filmography.role_description: An elderly ham radio operator who is the town's only link to the outside world after a nuclear attack.
filmography.plot: A small suburban community struggles to survive and maintain hope after a nuclear war destroys civilization.

filmography.title: On an Island with You
filmography.role_description: A naval officer in this musical romance set in Hawaii.
filmography.plot: A movie star goes to Hawaii and gets involved in a romantic triangle with a naval officer and her co-star.

filmography.title: East Side, West Side
filmography.role_description: A man who tries to help a woman whose marriage is threatened by infidelity and murder.
filmography.plot: A New York socialite questions her marriage when her husband is implicated in the murder of his former mistress.
